review.text: A shrewdly made documentary about the rise and fall of Plato's Retreat, the infamous Manhattan sex club of the '70s and '80s. A lot of the patrons were suburban schlubs, and the movie does justice to their odd... normality. The least classy person there was owner Larry Levenson, a nudnick who made the nightly bacchanals feel as friendly — and about as sexy — as a bar mitzvah. American Swing drolly evokes this Romper Room of middle-class exhibitionism, with its petri dish of a swimming pool and its icky lasagna- and-chicken buffet.
